availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William W. Smith (Harrison County, Kentucky, marshal)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, marshal. Georgia native. Married to Emily Barnett Smith in Harrison County, Kentucky, on September 14, 1834. Married to Elizabeth Hamilton Remington Keller Smith in Harrison County, Kentucky, on February 2, 1859. Stepfather of Green R. Keller, Anna Keller, and James Keller. Town marshal of Cynthiana in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film 000216896, p. 31.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994037, Harrison County Marriages, p. 174.
Lineage Book of the Charter Members of the National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, eds. Mary S. Lockwood and Susan Riviere Hetzel (Washington, D. C.: National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, 1891-1939) vol. 16: 1896, p. 215.
Sons of the American Revolution Membership Applications, 1889-1970, National Society of the Sons of the American Revolution, Louisville, KY, National 51096, State 2525.
